column4: I have a few speed and compatibility questions: would Ubuntu run faster than XP on a system with low specs?
you can make it faster, specs of the box ?
give more details in your questions and some patience for answers
specs of the box ?
Specs - 2.8ghz p4 2gigs of ram, onboard video
that's fine for both, win and ubu
you can always tear down a linux-system to your needs, not so with windows, so that ubu will boot up faster and will be less ressource hungry, but above a ghz, standard apps run on both
would you say that Win or Ubuntu would necessarily run faster, depending on what I do with the machine?
do you know of a site where I can find a method for tearding down some of the apps
faster is a wide word, like in booting up , or in loading apps, or in copying files , or in ..
though not needed for that box, can fasten it by :
for inet, you can sort out uneeded services in win as you can disable them in ubuntu, in general ubuntu as a linux can be made faster, because it needs less security-related stuff
this is why linux is common in server-apps, no, it's not less secure, but more developed for it
which app do you need in win ?
ReadPlease
read what ?
which windows program you need in ubuntu ?
ReadPlease
idk,  what it is it ?
there are few readers for ubuntu, too
http://appdb.winehq.org/objectManager.php?sClass=application&iId=1763
nice, if it's in the wine-db, you can probably use it under linux
